org.kocakosm.pitaya.io

Class Scanf

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kocakosm.pitaya.io.Scanf

  • public final class Scanf
extends Object
    Very simple utility class to easily read from the standard input. For a more powerful API, use Scanner.
    Author:
    Osman KOCAK

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static BigDecimal readBigDecimal()
      Reads the next line from the standard input and parses it into a BigDecimal value.

      Reads the next line from the standard input and parses it into a BigInteger value.

      Reads the next line from the standard input and parses it into a BigInteger value with the specified radix.

      Reads the next line from the standard input and parses it into a boolean value.

    • Method Detail

      • readString

        public static String readString()
                         throws IOException
        Reads the next line from the standard input using the system's default charset.
        Returns:
        the next line read from the standard input.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the standard input cannot be read.

      • readString

        public static String readString(Charset charset)
                         throws IOException
        Reads the next line from the standard input using the given charset.
        Parameters:
        charset - the charset to use.
        Returns:
        the next line read from the standard input.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if charset is null.
        IOException - if the standard input cannot be read.

      • readBoolean

        public static boolean readBoolean()
                           throws IOException
        Reads the next line from the standard input and parses it into a boolean value. The strings "true", "on", "yes" (ignoring spaces and case) return true, all other strings will return false.
        Returns:
        the parsed boolean value.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the standard input cannot be read.

      • readInt

        public static int readInt()
                   throws IOException
        Reads the next line from the standard input and parses it into an int value.
        Returns:
        the parsed int value.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the standard input cannot be read.
        NumberFormatException - if the line cannot be parsed.

      • readInt

        public static int readInt(int radix)
                   throws IOException
        Reads the next line from the standard input and parses it into an int value with the specified radix.
        Parameters:
        radix - the radix to be used in interpreting the read line.
        Returns:
        the parsed int value.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the standard input cannot be read.
        NumberFormatException - if the line cannot be parsed.

      • readLong

        public static long readLong()
                     throws IOException
        Reads the next line from the standard input and parses it into a long value.
        Returns:
        the parsed long value.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the standard input cannot be read.
        NumberFormatException - if the line cannot be parsed.
